attributes.action: Set out an Act of Parliament preventing building on disused railway alignments.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Many of the old railway in this country were ripped up in the 1960s and 1970s and subsequently built upon. This has had the result of preventing the re-opening of railway routes that could today be viable and help reduce congestion on other routes as well as on road. A good example would be the case of the former route to Didcot, via Winchester Chesil and Newbury.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Set out an Act of Parliament preventing building on disused railway alignments."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22237


Prime Minister's Office
